intro: Solanum aviculare var. brisbanense, commonly known as the Brisbane nightshade, is a perennial herb native to eastern Australia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that develop into round, fleshy berries. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in swampy or wetland areas. While not widely cultivated, it is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings due to its rapid growth and adaptability.
